comments:
I'm running Eclipse 3.1M6 with eclipse.buildId=I20050401-1645 and I keep getting
these messages in my error log from the Plug-in org.eclipse.ui:

Error 2005-04-18 15:38:27.926 Unhandled event loop exception

Eclipse still comes up, but I think it might be causing problems with my plug-in
connections (for example Lomboz won't display the JSP editor).  I'm running JDK
1.5 and when I go to "Manage Configuration" under the Help menu I don't get any
messages about my plug-ins not being configured properly.  I didn't have these
problems with 3.0, but I need support for Java JDK 1.5.
Are there no stack traces in your .log file?

Hi Kim,

Thanks for the quick response.  :0)  Yep.  There's no mention of any stack trace
information in the error log.  Is there a way I could explicitly get it to push
out extra info?

--Amy

By error log do you mean the Error Log view or the actual .log text file in your
workspace/.metadata location?  When an unhandled event loop exception occurs we
SHOULD be logging some kind of stack trace...

Hi Kim,

Here's the message from that .metadata/.log file I got when I tried opening the
Lomboz JSP editor...

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-04-19 09:58:15.156
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

This is a bug in the com.objectlearn.jdt.j2ee plugin.  They appear to be
referring to internal classes which is a VERY BAD THING.  You should report this
against the plugin provider.
Thanks, Kim.  :0)  I'll pass the info along with Lomboz.  -- Amy
